option.value: /* * ======================================== * ENEMY HEALTH BAR - SETUP GUIDE * ======================================== * * STEP 1: CREATE THE HEALTH BAR UI PREFAB * ======================================== * * 1. Create a new Canvas in your scene (if testing) or in a prefab: * - Right-click in Hierarchy > UI > Canvas * - Set Canvas to "World Space" (not Screen Space!) * - Set Canvas RenderMode: World Space * - Set Canvas Size: X=2, Y=0.5 (or adjust to your liking) * * 2. Add a CanvasGroup component to the Canvas: * - Select the Canvas * - Add Component > Canvas Group * - This allows us to fade the health bar in/out * * 3. Create the background: * - Right-click Canvas > UI > Image * - Name it "HealthBar_Background" * - Anchor: Stretch/Stretch (fill parent) * - Color: Black or dark gray with some transparency (e.g., RGB: 0,0,0, A: 100) * - Add some padding if you want (Left:5, Right:5, Top:5, Bottom:5) * * 4. Create the health fill bar: * - Right-click Background > UI > Image * - Name it "HealthBar_Fill" * - Anchor: Stretch/Stretch * - Set Margins: Left:5, Right:5, Top:5, Bottom:5 (creates padding) * - Color: Green (or any color you like) * - Image Type: Filled * - Fill Method: Horizontal * - Fill Origin: Left * - Fill Amount: 1 (this will be controlled by script) * * 5. Add the EnemyHealthBar script: * - Select the Canvas (root of the health bar) * - Add Component > EnemyHealthBar * - Assign references: * * Health Bar Fill: Drag the "HealthBar_Fill" image here * * Canvas Group: Drag the Canvas (with CanvasGroup component) here * - Adjust settings: * * Hide Delay: 2 (seconds before fading out) * * Fade Speed: 2 (how fast it fades) * * 6. Position the health bar above the enemy: * - Select the Canvas * - Set Position: X=0, Y=1.5, Z=0 (adjust Y to be above enemy head) * - Set Rotation: X=0, Y=0, Z=0 * - Set Scale: X=0.005, Y=0.005, Z=0.005 (much smaller for compact bar) * * 7. Save as prefab: * - Drag the Canvas from Hierarchy to your Prefabs folder * - Name it "EnemyHealthBar_Prefab" * - Delete the Canvas from the scene (you'll instantiate it on enemies) * * ======================================== * STEP 2: ADD HEALTH BAR TO ENEMY PREFAB * ======================================== * * 1. Open your enemy prefab (Ghost, Enemy, etc.) * * 2. Drag the "EnemyHealthBar_Prefab" into the enemy prefab: * - Drag it as a child of the enemy root * - Position it above the enemy (Y=2 or wherever looks good) * * 3. Select the enemy root and find the EnemyHealth component: * - In the Inspector, find the "Health Bar" field * - Drag the EnemyHealthBar_Prefab (the child you just added) into this slot * * 4. Save the prefab * * ======================================== * STEP 3: TEST * ======================================== * * 1. Enter Play mode * 2. Spawn an enemy * 3. The health bar should be invisible at first * 4. When the enemy takes damage: * - Health bar appears (fades in) * - Shows current health percentage * - Changes color: Green > Yellow > Red * - After 2 seconds of no damage, fades out * * ======================================== * QUICK ALTERNATIVE (NO CANVAS) * ======================================== * * If you want an even simpler approach using a 3D quad: * * 1. Create a Quad (3D Object > Quad) * 2. Create a material with a texture or color * 3. Use a shader that supports transparency * 4. Scale the quad using localScale in the EnemyHealthBar script * 5. This is lighter but less flexible than UI * * ======================================== * TROUBLESHOOTING * ======================================== * * Health bar not showing: * - Check that Canvas is set to "World Space" * - Check that CanvasGroup is assigned * - Check that Health Bar Fill image is assigned * - Check that enemy has EnemyHealth script with healthBar reference * * Health bar too big/small: * - Adjust Canvas scale (try 0.01 for all axes) * - Adjust Canvas size (try 2x0.5) * * Health bar facing wrong direction: * - The script automatically rotates to face camera in LateUpdate * - Make sure Camera.main is set correctly * * Health bar not fading: * - Check that CanvasGroup component is on the Canvas * - Check that it's assigned in the EnemyHealthBar script * * ======================================== */
